snippet: The police fired on workers engaged in a strike at a platinum mine. The news agency SAPA reported that 18 people had been killed.
abstract: Police fire on striking workers at a platinum mine in Marikana, South Africa, reportedly killing at least 18 people; incident is latest sign of deepening divide between the governing African National Congress and a nation that is increasingly impatient with deep poverty, rampant unemployment and yawning inequality.
lead_paragraph: The police fired on workers engaged in a strike at a platinum mine. The news agency SAPA reported that 18 people had been killed.

headline.seo: South African Police Fire on Striking Miners
headline.main: Mine Strike Mayhem Stuns South Africa as Police Open Fire
headline.print_headline: Strike by Armed Miners in South Africa Provokes a Fatal Police Response
